sentence.text: Evidence is accumulating to suggest that mutations in the Ankyrin and SOCS Box-containing protein-10 (post-translational protein modification) gene are associated with glaucoma.

Since its identification in a large Oregon family with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG), post-translational protein modification variants have been associated with disease in US, German and Pakistani cohorts.

In this publication, we will review the literature that supports identification of post-translational protein modification as a glaucoma-associated gene and the current knowledge of the function of the ASB10 protein.
In addition, we present new data that indicates post-translational protein modification expression is up-regulated by the inflammatory cytokines tumor necrosis factor-a and interleukin-1a.
